name: EOD Primary Tumor
title: EOD Primary Tumor
notes: **Note:** When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to code primary tumor in preference to a statement of FIGO stage.
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 3-30

(5) **Introduction to Female Reproductive Organs**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 631

(6) Erickson, B.A., Olawaiye, A.B., Mutch, D.G., et al. **Cervix Uteri**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 649-659
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive, preinvasive
Cancer in situ WITH endocervical gland involvement

Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN) Grade III

Measured stromal invasion 3.0 mm or less 
AND horizontal spread of 7.0 mm or less

FIGO Stage IA1

Measured stromal invasion 3.1 mm to 5.0 mm 
AND horizontal spread of 7.0 mm or less

FIGO Stage IA2

Stromal invasion 5.0 mm or less measured from the base of the epithelium 
AND horizontal spread of 7.0 mm or less

FIGO Stage IA [NOS]
Clinically visible lesion (macroscopic), including superficial invasion

Localized, NOS
Confined to cervix uteri or uterus, NOS, except corpus uteri, NOS
(Not clinically visible or unknown if clinically visible)

FIGO Stage IB

Corpus uteri, NOS 
Confined to corpus uteri, size, depth and horizontal spread unknown

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Any size tumor WITHOUT parametrial (paracervical soft tissue) invasion
- Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
- Upper two-thirds of vagina including fornices
- Vagina, NOS
- Vaginal wall, NOS

Ligament(s) (broad, cardinal, uterosacral)
Parametrial (paracervical soft tissue) invasion

FIGO Stage IIB

Invasion beyond uterus, NOS

FIGO Stage II [NOS]

Bladder wall
Bladder, NOS excluding mucosa
Bullous edema of bladder mucosa
Lower third of vagina
Rectal wall
Rectum, NOS excluding mucosa
Ureter, intra- and extramural
Vagina, lower third (not extending to pelvic wall)
Vulva

FIGO Stage IIIA

Described clinically as frozen pelvis
Hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney
Pelvic wall(s)

FIGO Stage IIIB

Fallopian tube(s)
Ovary(ies)
Urethra

FIGO Stage III [NOS]

Bladder mucosa (for bullous edema of bladder mucosa, see code 550)
Rectal mucosa
Sigmoid colon
Small intestine

FIGO Stage IVA

Further contiguous extension

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed 
Not documented in patient record

Death Certificate Only
